translated: Repentance Text
Having repented all the offenses of the body, I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Jewels. With a sincere mind, I exhort and beseech:
The Buddhas of the ten directions who have attained enlightenment, I beseech them to turn the wheel of Dharma and bring peace and joy to all sentient beings.
The Buddhas of the ten directions, if they wish to relinquish their lives,

I now prostrate and beseech them to remain for a long time. Having exhorted and beseeched, I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Jewels. With a sincere mind, I rejoice in all the merits of giving,
Upholding precepts, cultivating meditation, wisdom arising from body, speech, and mind,
The practices of the Three Vehicles in the past, present, and future, and the immeasurable blessings of humans and gods, I rejoice in them all.
Having rejoiced, I take refuge and pay homage to the Three Jewels. With a sincere mind, I dedicate the meritorious deeds I have created,
All of which are harmoniously combined for the sake of liberating sentient beings.
I correctly dedicate them to the path of Buddhahood.
Offenses should be repented in this way.
Exhorting, rejoicing in merits, and dedicating them to enlightenment.
Having made the dedication, one should take refuge and pay homage to the Three Jewels. With a sincere mind, one should make the vow that all sentient beings equally arouse the bodhi mind.
Fix the mind and always contemplate the buddhas of the ten directions.
Again, vow that all sentient beings will forever destroy afflictions.

Again, the evening verse: In the west, the sun has already set.
Afflictions are still not removed.
Old age, sickness, and death are imminent.
Looking at each other, we will not stay long.
Moment by moment, the years pass quickly,
Just like a fish in shallow water.
Encouraging all practitioners,
To cultivate and study until reaching the state of no remainder.
Midnight impermanence verse - all of you should each contemplate the body's location,
Bones and flesh are like floating and firm coverings.
Earth, water, fire, and wind temporarily form the body.
When the four elements disperse, there is originally no self.
One smelly flesh bag turns into a boil.
Scattered and rotten, returning to ashes and soil.
Late night impermanence verse - the light of time turns a thousand times,
Suddenly arriving at the first watch of the night.
Impermanence arrives moment by moment,
Always dwelling with the king of death.
Encouraging all practitioners,
To cultivate and study until reaching the state of no remainder.
Repentance of the Six Sense Organs - we have been deceived by the six thieves since immeasurable eons ago.
Dwelling in the state of oneness, yet giving rise to discrimination together.
The eye faculty always loves forms,
The ear discriminates sounds,
The nose is deluded by other fragrances,
The tongue always craves various flavors,
The body always enjoys tactile sensations,
The mind's characteristics pervade all objects of cognition.
Still, the inverted mind is firm.
Sinking and revolving in the ocean of birth and death.
Having repented, I take refuge and bow three times - I vow that from today until I realize enlightenment,
The six thieves will always be transformed into the six supernatural powers.
The three poisons will be transformed into the three liberations.
The same true suchness, equal enlightenment.
Not abandoning birth and death, realizing nirvana.
Always in the six destinies, saving sentient beings.
Together realizing the unsurpassed way of the Tathagata.
With utmost sincerity, I make this vow - I vow that my eyes will always see the Buddha.
I vow that my ears will always hear the sound of the Dharma.
I vow that my nose will not smell any other fragrance.
I vow that my mouth will always recite the paramitas.
I vow that my body will not be tainted by any wrong objects.
I vow that my mind will not grasp at conceptualized objects.
I vow that my mind will be able to eliminate the thief of afflictions.
I vow that I will always reach the city of nirvana.
I vow that all sentient beings will attain Buddhahood.
I vow to universally realize the causes of nirvana.
Having made the vow, one takes refuge and pays homage to the Three Jewels: Sentient beings are boundless, I vow to deliver them all.
Afflictions are boundless, I vow to sever them all.
Dharma gates are inexhaustible, I vow to study them all.
Unsurpassed Buddhahood, I vow to attain it.
Listen to the teaching of impermanence at the right time: If form and desire do not abide,
Grass moves and is tainted by various dusts.
